file_content.text: Been saving a bottle of Cassandran brandy for a special occasion. This seems like one. Come on....
Didn't expect to see you again. What's the occasion, Captain?
Republic Customs is onto you. I kept them off your back--for now.
You have the vault's coordinates. You didn't have to come warn me, but you did.
Where I come from, the best friends are the ones who lie for you. Guess you're a better friend than I thought.
I've always been on your side, Beryl.
Don't sound so surprised.
Never figured I could count on anybody traveling with Risha.
Been a while since anyone stood up for me. Feels like I'm always on my own.
What am I, Mistress Beryl? Spare parts?
Pipe down, Argo. The captain knows what I mean. Right?
We're just friends, right?
Not a clue.
Sure, of course. What did you think I meant? Because I didn't mean that.
You don't have to rush off right away, do you?
[Flirt] Do you have time?
You bought me a nice head start. Figure I've got time to spare.
[Flirt] You bet I do.
Glad you finally see I'm not your enemy.
It's about time you noticed.
Me too, and I won't forget it.
Friendship isn't all I had in mind for us.
[Flirt] I can be more.
Argo, start packing. I'd like some privacy.
Anything to get off this Maker-forsaken planet, Mistress Beryl.
I'll keep watch outside. Call when you need me.
I'll, uh, just go count the rakghouls....
Wish we had more time, but I better get going.
Get out of this business.
Let's move, Argo. We're leaving this party.
I want you to have this. Saved me more times than I can count. Hope it does the same for you.
I'm glad we're parting as friends.
Take care, Beryl.
Risha doesn't deserve a partner like you. Watch your back, all right?
I didn't expect a reward, but thanks.
I appreciate it.
It's not a reward, just something to remember me by.
If I don't like it, I can always just sell it.
I'm sure it's worth something.
Uh, right. Well, it's yours now. Hmph.
I'll get off Taris while the getting's good. I know Argo's ready.
You have no idea, Mistress Beryl.
Thanks for everything, Captain.
This friend expects cold hard credits.
Show some appreciation.
It's all about the money, huh? Here, this should keep your freighter flying.
If I were you, I'd get off Taris before Soganti tries again.
You should fly, too.
Maybe we'll meet again someday. Thanks for not turning me in.
Don't be rude.
Hope you find whatever you're after, Captain. If you do, look me up. Wouldn't mind seeing you again.
We'll do more than see each other, Beryl.
[Flirt] Likewise.
Promises, promises. Now you've got my hopes up....
Come on, Argo. It's time we were leaving Taris.
That's what all the girls say.
It's a common reaction.
Gee, what a romantic.
I never visit the same spaceport twice, if I can help it.
Don't get your hopes up.
Sure. Whatever you say.
Let's go, Argo. We're done here.
I never thought this day would come, Mistress Beryl. Oh happy, happy day....
Good girl.
Come on, Argo. Let's leave this stinking slimeball.
I really just came for a cash reward.
Got any credits?
You've just made me the happiest droid in the galaxy, Mistress Beryl.
Good luck in Zone Zero. You'll need it.
Hey, look at that--the Republic just updated my contract log as "complete."
And right on time, my spaceport friend granted me access to the Republic sensor array. Let's find us a vault.
It was that easy for you to get access?
That's all it took?
Never easy. I just make it look that way.
Tell me about this mysterious friend of yours.
Friend, huh?
A lonely technician with a boring job. Didn't take much to wrap him around my finger.
What's the matter? Jealous?
I'm waiting on you.
Cool your thrusters. I'm working as fast as I can.
Hmm... sensors are picking up the vault's unique radiation signature. That's good.
A-ha, there it is! Oh... your vault is in Zone Zero. That's bad.
Zone Zero?
It's always "good news, bad news" with you, isn't it?
You're no help.
I like to think of myself as a balanced individual.
If I can't get to that vault, you're dead.
Bad for you.
Should I activate defense protocols, Mistress Beryl?
What, spill oil everywhere and hope the captain slips and falls? I can handle this.
Zone Zero is no-man's-land. When the Republic first got here, it sent a bunch of surveyors to map the region.
One surveyor made it back alive. Said the place is overrun with things worse than rakghouls. Nobody goes there.
If that's where the vault is, that's where I'm going.
Nobody except me.
Is there any place to land a starship in all that mess?
Can't I just fly there?
Sorry, the only way is on foot.
No man should march into certain death without a kiss for luck.
[Flirt] I may never return.
I'll ask, but Argo's real picky about his men.
I beg your pardon, Mistress!
Sounds like nonsense.
Feel free to check it out for yourself.
You'll need serious hardware to crack that vault. Risha's good at getting into places she isn't supposed to. Maybe talk to her.
Here's your fee for helping complete my contract. We're even now. Good luck, Captain.
It's been interesting knowing you, Captain. Have fun out there.
I can count the number of times I've been truly impressed in my life on one hand, Captain.
Congratulations. You walking in with those core samples just got added to the list.
Why didn't you tell me about your side business? I thought we were friends.
They're not core samples.
Guess there's no point beating around the bantha anymore.
I'm a legend in my own time.
Humility is overrated, anyway.
I always deliver, sweetheart.
[Flirt] Anything for you.
Shame to see a man like you wasted on Risha.
Argo, take this cargo pod and stow it with the others.
When will we finally leave this accursed swamp? The humidity makes my joints rust....
If I'm gonna be smuggling relics, I expect to be well paid.
Stop lying to me.
Smuggling relics? But I'd never do anything against the--heh, even I don't believe that one.
How'd you find out what I'm really up to? What happened with the scavengers?
What's to stop me from turning you in?
You're a criminal.
You get me arrested for smuggling, I can't help you find that vault. You'd be blasting yourself in the foot.
Turns out, Tyrodall faked his death by rakghouls and joined the scavengers. He told me everything.
I met an old friend of yours.
I never liked that guy. Where's he now?
He's fertilizing this beautiful swamp.
Dead for real.
Stupid Devaronian. He probably drew first.
I left him at the scavenger base.
Still alive.
With any luck, the rakghouls will get him for real next time.
None of your business.
Fine, forget I asked.
You don't want to know.
Sounds like I won't be hearing from Tyrodall again.
Doesn't matter how I know. Just give me my cut.
Credits--now.
There is no cut, and I'm not letting you blackmail me.
Sorry I didn't keep things on the up-and-up, but you're working with Risha. I've got trust issues there.
I don't want these relics decorating some fat Senator's bedroom. They're going to the descendents of Taris survivors, where they belong.
You've got a real heart of gold, don't you?
You feel that strongly?
There's more to life than profit. If people understood that, the galaxy would be a better place.
Fine by me.
Oh. Well... I'm glad you feel that way.
Don't involve me in your crimes again.
I don't like being used.
Admit it--you had fun.
Ovold needs supplies, and I need those core samples. I can't help you until that's done.
I finally located the other supplies you need to deliver. They were lost when Tyrodall got killed by the rakghouls.
A Republic patrol found the supplies with Tyrodall's remains. Dropped everything off at an outpost near the lake.
What do you know about this lake? Is there swimming?
Lake?
Only if you enjoy bathing in acid.
I guess the rakghouls didn't leave much of him behind.
Tyrodall's remains, too?
Just bloody clothes. The rakghouls turned Tyrodall into one of them. I try not to think about it.
Lazy Republic troopers. They couldn't have made the delivery?
That wasn't helpful at all.
I suspect they're a little busy hunting down the pirates and scavengers attacking the supply routes.
All you have to do is swing by the outpost, grab the supplies and take them to an engineer named Ovold.
Ovold will give you some planetary core samples to bring back to me. Got it?
What do you need with planetary core samples?
Core samples?
I have to transport them to Coruscant as part of my contract. It's a science thing.
A simple job.
Yeah, that's what Tyrodall said.
You'd better have that vault's location when I get back.
And then we're done.
I'm working on it, don't you worry.
Grab the supplies from the outpost, get them to Ovold and return to me with his core samples. Good luck.
Hey, Captain. How are things out there?
Beautiful scenery, great weather, man-eating creatures trying to kill me. You should be here.
How do you think?
That's the problem with running your own business. You always miss the good times.
That crazy Republic scientist got his gear.
I made my delivery.
Glad to hear it. That's one down, one to go.
You got a location on that thing I'm after?
Where's my vault?
Tracking down a centuries-old vault in this mess is harder than it sounds.
Doctor Vernan needs those sensors at his research camp. Keep your eyes open for rakghouls.
I only have two deliveries left. Soon as you handle them, we'll find your vault.
The first job's for a Republic scientist named Vernan. He's got a research camp in rakghoul territory.
What exactly am I delivering?
What's in the container?
Some kind of sensor equipment. Don't know what it's for.
You've got to be kidding.
I wish I was joking. Don't know how anyone lives with those man-eaters all around.
What else do you need me to deliver?
Who's the other client?
Excavation supplies, but I'm still tracking those down. I'll call your holo when I find them.
I'll start working on your job while you handle mine. Isn't cooperation grand?
Hello again, Captain. I didn't know you and Thorne were acquainted.
Agent Soganti, what a lovely surprise. It's only been a day since your last inquisition--I mean, inspection.
Don't you Republic Customs boys have better things to do than turn my warehouse upside-down again?
I can inspect this warehouse whenever I want. It's the law.
Take Doctor Vernan's delivery, Captain. There's no reason for you to stick around.
Have fun with Agent Fancypants.
You kids play nice.
You're a regular comedian. Maybe I'll find a reason to keep you around, so you can make me laugh all the time.
I'm on my way.
Don't get eaten. Already got enough partners on my conscience.
What kind of man would I be if I left you alone with this guy?
[Flirt] I'll stick around.
A smart man. I can take care of myself--but thanks.
Why is Republic Customs so interested in you?
Will you be all right?
Just between you and me, Soganti's a very lonely man.
Poke around the warehouse all you want, agent. You won't find anything out of order.
Ehhh... what did I just step in, Thorne?
My apologies, sir. I believe that is my hydraulic fluid....
Argo, you're leaking oil again. You wanna set this whole warehouse on fire?
The Maker said it is better to burn out than rust away. Perhaps I'm testing that wisdom, Mistress.
I'm looking for Beryl Thorne.
That's me. Argo's what passes for my second-in-command. I recognize you from Risha's holo.
Let's get one thing straight. The only reason I agreed to help is because my contract supplying the Taris reclamation project is at risk.
Looked like easy credits. Turns out, Taris is anything but easy, and there are lots of interesting ways to die.
As long as you're breathing, you're still in business.
At least you're alive.
Some business. I'm barely covering my own expenses.
Why don't you just leave?
So quit.
Can't afford to. Not yet.
If I don't finish my contract, I don't get paid. Tyrodall--my partner--died on a supply run. Put me in a real bind.
I'll find that vault, but I have to finish my contract to do it. You work for me and I'll work for you. Deal?
Can't your walking rust bucket handle things?
Why not send the droid?
Not a chance. The scavengers would be on Argo like gundarks on fresh meat.
I wasn't aware this was a negotiation.
Do I have a choice?
You can always wander around and hope you bump into the vault by accident.
Sweeten the offer.
A real mercenary, huh? I stashed some credits for a rainy day. You'll get them when the job's done.
Watch your step. My droid sprung an oil leak. You might be safer someplace else, catch my drift?
I met some of those interesting ways getting here.
I've noticed.
I've handled worse.
